intro: Hieracium leucoplethum, commonly known as the whitefield hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Hieracium leucoplethum is known for its ornamental value but can also be invasive in certain regions.
